description: Episode of Series "Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series". In a teachers' workshop, Dorothy Heathcote, England's outstanding drama educator, explores the theory of improvised drama as a teaching tool for all classroom teachers. She analyses her unique process, explaining and illustrating techniques for developing materials, the use of dramatic elements and the segmenting of ideas to achieve dramatic focus.
